item.title: Oracle Fusion Middleware Chef Cookbook - New Release!
item.description: Yesterday, I released a new version (0.2.0) of my Oracle Fusion Middleware Cookbook hosted on Chef Supermarket

item.title: Running Oracle BPM 12c on AWS using Vagrant and Chef
item.description: In this post, I will show how to create an AWS EC2 Instance with an Oracle BPM 12c Quickstart Domain created. And I will use previous post for related tasks.

item.title: Chef Cookbook for Oracle Fusion Middleware 12c
item.description: Provisioning tools have change the way we create software environments: How much time we spend installing OS, databases, configuring platforms, applications? Now you can translate this steps into code, getting the software development benefits and challenges into infrastructure: versioning, reuse, continuous improvement.

item.title: Create a NFS instance on AWS using Vagrant and Chef
item.description: I was creating AWS EC2 instances to install Oracle Fusion Middleware products, and I found an issue: How to download Oracle’s installers if I want to use installers on several instances? This could consume a lot of network bandwith and I want to make this process repeatable, so I don’t want to wait 1 hour each installation only downloading files.
